details.appearance:
~ How They Met ~

Nepnik took a team to discover what was causing soldiers to disappear in the mountains near ground zero of the great Cataclysm. They discovered Claudia in a tower and terrors unimaginable burst from where she stood. All, but Nepnik, died from fear. Passing this test, Claudia allowed him a wish to be granted. Looking around at the friend’s he’d lost, a different kind of madness took hold of him and he leapt from the tower. As he lay crippled and dying at the base of the mountain, Claudia appeared beside him, saying, “Wish to be saved and I will grant you new life.” Head unable to lift, eyes fluttering shut, Nepnik whispered in return, “I wish for you to be granted new life.” As his soul slipped out with those words, Claudia gathered it up in her arms and kissed his ghostly face tenderly. “Granted.” She smiled and pressed her forehead to his. “But you're coming with me.”

Claudia, having seen into other worlds, knew how to create a Manikin. She placed herself and Nepnik’s soul into the vessel, effectively trading her ability to grant wishes for the ability to fuse with the squirrel. She dropped her binding stone into the belly of the construct and together they walked out of the tower.

No longer imprisoned, Claudia and Nepnik walk the world as a Squirrel Construct disguised as a real flesh and blood Squirrel Warrior behind illusionary runes.

~ Nepnik ~

Before he was a construct, Nepnik was the most trusted messenger of the Squirrel race. When he returned, despite the illusion runes, those he’d known since he was a kit immediately knew something was off. For one, he didn’t smell like a Squirrel. That, combined with the fact that he returned alone from the mission months later, left them suspicious of him. He was exiled by his people for they weren’t sure what to believe. They couldn’t let him stay if there was a chance he’d murdered his entire unit, yet couldn’t kill him if his outlandish story were true.

~ Claudia ~

Claudia was never technically part of this world. She was of the old demi-god celestial race Kazrem Azryel (Loosely translated: “Silent Watch”). During a Celestial battle with Cthulhu, Nyx opened a portal to escape and Claudia followed close behind her. The pain of believing her people have been extinguished keeps her silent about her past and she remains hidden much of the time. Claudia simply enjoys the view through the eyes she constructed for Nepnik.

~ Derelict ~

After spending his entire biological life as a Squirrel, Nepnik found it hard to find a place he felt at home. Whenever they’d get comfortable in a village or city, someone would inevitably figure out about Claudia or realize he was a construct and they’d be forced out.

They finally tried finding a safe place to live in Havenbrook, the largest empire city. In a city of so many people one should be able to disappear among the masses. For a time that was true. Until a group of rich city kids were beating on a traveling peddler for not giving them a better discount and Nepnik intervened. In the scuffle, his arm was ripped away from his body. He grabbed it from the punk who tore it off and wielded it as a weapon against them. The rich kids ran off screaming for the guards.

Clapping brought Nepniks attention to a dark alleyway. A large Minotaur with wisps of purple in his hair stepped out, grinning. “You’ll need a place to hold up for a while. Those rich pricks won’t let this go until they find someone else to be angry with.”

Nepnik eyed him suspiciously.

The Minotaur pointed at the Squirrels eyes. “Your friend, there, is welcome to tag along.”

Nepnik looked at the peddler.

“Not him,” the Minotaur chuckled. “The lady watching through your eyes.”

Claudia stepped out of the construct and showed herself in full banshee form, believing he’d quickly change his mind. Tendrils of dark energy stretched out from her and living nightmares jumped up from the ground to rush at the Minotaur.

The Peddler ran away, screeching like a mad man, leaving his wares behind.

“Name’s Mogli,” The Minotaur said, breathing in the tendrils and waving nightmares away as if they were smoke from a match. “Welcome home.”

After joining the Derelicts, Nepnik became a skillful rogue due to his unarmored construct body being able to camouflage him. In a short time, Mogli rarely went anywhere without Nepnik concealed nearby.
details.notes:
Sneak Attack Aides

CANTRIPS

  • True Strike: Situationally useful

LEVEL 1 Spells

  • Grease: If they can’t keep their balance, they’ll fall prone. That’s where you come in!
  • Faerie Fire: One of my favorite spells. Make them light up like New Year’s Eve then strike!
  • Find Familiar: Besides being cute, your Familiar can use the Help action to set you up to strike!
  • Sleep: While the enemy catches some Z’s, they’re defenseless!
  • Tasha’s Hideous Laughter: Attacking someone while they’re on the ground laughing at you is a freaky mental image, but you can’t say it’s not effective!

LEVEL 2 Spells

  • Blindness/Deafness: Attacks against a blinded enemy are at advantage and their attacks will be at disadvantage. This is a very solid option.
  • Hold Person: Attacks against paralyzed enemies are at advantage. On a hit, it’s an automatic crit. This is lethal!
  • Invisibility: You’ll still need to use your Cunning Action to take the Hide action, but it will be considerably easier to get the jump on your target!

LEVEL 3 Spells

  • Hypnotic Pattern: Creatures affected by this spell will be charmed and incapacitated while they stare at the pretty lights. You know what to do!

LEVEL 4 Spells

  • Greater Invisibility: This is awesome for all of the same reasons as the regular Invisibility spell. But now you don’t lose your invisibility when attacking! (Just don’t forget to use a bonus action to Hide!)

system.description:
• Category

    • Melee Weapon

  • Damage

    • 1d8

  • Damage Type

    • Piercing

  • Properties

    • Finesse

Includes:

  • 1x Backpack

  • 1x Ball Bearings (Bag of 1000)

  • 1x String (10 feet)

  • 1x Bell

  • 5x Candle

  • 1x Crowbar

  • 1x Hammer

  • 10x Piton

  • 1x Lantern, Hooded

  • 2x Oil, Flask

  • 5x Rations (1 Supply)

  • 1x Tinderbox

  • 1x Waterskin

  • 1x Rope, Hempen (50 Feet)

This set of often sharp and slender metal instruments are needed to crack locks and carefully spy into mechanisms. You can use an action to open a lock by making a thieves’ tools check against a DC determined by the quality of the lock being picked.

• Your body has built-in defensive layers, which determine your armor class.

    • You gain no AC benefit from wearing armor, but if you are using a shield, you apply its bonus as normal.

      • Heavy Armor - ⅔ to full health

        • AC: 18

          • Note: Disadvantage on Stealth checks.

      • Medium Armor - ⅓ to just under ⅔ health

        • AC: 15

      • Unarmored - Under ⅓ health

        • AC: 11 + your Dexterity modifier

          • Note: Advantage on Stealth Checks

• Although most Manikin have runes inscribed inside their vessel that force them to follow the orders of their masters, Claudia made sure to inscribe free will into Nepnik’s vessel.

    • Nepnik can't be controlled by anyone besides his constructor, which is Claudia and she refuses to, so literally nobody will ever control the will of Nepnik by any means, magical or otherwise.

    • Those who know constructs will believe he is following a certain set of rules all Constructs must follow and will be caught off guard when he acts outside of these bounds.

    • Nepnik’s soul cannot leave the construct without risking his soul dissipating into the ether.

• The construct has no mind that can be read, therefore Nepnik's thoughts can't be read through telepathy or by any other means.

  • You can't be compelled to tell the truth by magic.

• They are not biologic, therefore Manikin don’t age the way biologics do.

    • However, their materials will slowly lose their magic essence over time when repeatedly damaged without repair.

  • Manikins don’t need to eat, drink, breathe, or sleep.

  • A Mankin is immune to poison and bleeding.

    • They are also immune to healing spells and cantrips.

  • You don’t need sleep so you use long rests to melt down gold to repair damage to your joints and armor. If you do not have gold to use, you cannot heal.

  • If you are broken down, someone else must aid you by repairing your damage.

• Your Manikin runs on pure energy, either from the sun or from lightning/electricity.

  • Instead of taking damage from lightning attacks, it helps empower you.

  • If you power completely down, someone else must aid you by pulling you into the sun or using lightning/electricity.

  • After a short/long rest you gain max Charges.

    • Starting out your Max Charge Storage is 6.

    • These Charges are used to carry out blinks and other actions described below.

• Manikin Resistance

    • Resistant to Cold and Force damage.

    • Immune to lightning damage.

      • In fact it heals him for half the damage dealt and, as mentioned above, energizes him.

  • Manikin Vulnerability

    • Vulnerable to piercing damage.

    • Highly vulnerable to fire damage.

      • Does greater damage

      • Melts gold into his joints, slowing him.

• You can have up to two melee weapons embedded within your arms, hands, or wrists.

    • Each weapon must have either the finesse or light property.

      • Both of these embedded weapons are considered part of you, therefore you cannot be disarmed of these embedded weapons, short of having your arms cut off.

  • As a bonus action, you can drop a trap from your pack.

  • As a bonus action, you can disarm and conceal a trap you are familiar with.

  • As a bonus action, you can launch a throwing knife, star, or other small projectiles you have concealed upon your person.

  • As a bonus action, you can pick up and conceal small throwable weapons you are familiar with.

yUrjxRVX0dhszYv1.name: Blink
yUrjxRVX0dhszYv1.description: • Expend 3 Charges to teleport to a location up to 15 feet from your current position.

system.description:
• Being a Squirrel you know how to teleport around the battlefield.

    • While organics use biological energy, as a Manikin you have to use elemental energy to use your teleportation magic.

    • Expend 3 Charges to teleport to a location up to 15 feet from your current position.

• You can Search as a bonus action on your turn or ready the reaction for when you’re waiting for something to happen.

    • If you are readying the reaction, you must say so on your turn, but do not have to specify what you are waiting for.
• You can use your reaction to reduce any falling damage you take by up to 5 x your rogue level.

• You do not make noise when you move.

  • You can leap straight up the distance of your movement.

  • You can leap up vertical surfaces without falling during the move.

• Only available with Medium Modular Armor Build.

    • Charisma +1 (Applied by Equipping Armor)

    • Additional Proficiency:

      • Performance Skill (Applied by Equipping Armor)

      • You were quite the musician when organic and are proficient with most Instruments. (Applied by Equipping Armor)

    • This is the form you use when wanting to appear more like a regular Squirrel, as your size fits the organic versions of your race.

• Only available with Heavy Modular Armor Build.

    • You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift. (Applied by Equipping Armor)

• Only available with Heavy Modular Armor Build.

  • Your armor is so thick it shines and reflects light, causing most to have a hard time focusing on anything other than you. (Applied by Equipping Armor)

• Only available with Heavy Modular Armor Build.
  • Strength +1 (Applied by Equipping Armor)
    • Allows the Use of HMA- True Defender Manuever
      • You are adept at throwing yourself in the way of harm to shield others. When a creature within 5 feet of you is targeted by an attack, you can throw yourself in front of an attack.
      • If the creature is willing, you may push them completely out of harm's way, becoming the target of the attack instead.
      • If they’re unwilling, you both take partial damage.

715H7ZYjQASb6Mvo.name: Rebound
715H7ZYjQASb6Mvo.description:
• If knocked down, you may use them to launch yourself back up.

  • If thrown into a wall, you may use them to launch yourself 5 feet away from the wall.

  • If thrown into an object you may use them to launch you and the object 5 feet away from one another.

    • As a bonus action or reaction, you may use this propelled momentum to strike out with your 1D6 dice at a creature within 5 feet.

      • If this is the first time this ability has been used within the target's presence this is considered a Surprise Attack and you may apply your Sneak Attack.

system.description:
• Only available with Medium Modular Armor Build.

    • Without armor to obstruct the illusionary magic of your runes, you may shift the illusions to perfectly blend into your surroundings as long as an enemy isn’t aware of your location.

    • Get advantage on Surprise Attacks.

effects.name: Chameleon - Stealth Advantage
effects.description:
• Without armor to obstruct the illusionary magic of your runes, you may shift the illusions to perfectly blend into your surroundings as long as an enemy isn’t aware of your location.

  • Advantage on Surprise Attacks.

715H7ZYjQASb6Mvo.name: Rebound
715H7ZYjQASb6Mvo.description:
• If knocked down, you may use them to launch yourself back up.

  • If thrown into a wall, you may use them to launch yourself 5 feet away from the wall.

  • If thrown into an object you may use them to launch you and the object 5 feet away from one another.

    • As a bonus action or reaction, you may use this propelled momentum to strike out with your 1D6 dice at a creature within 5 feet.

      • If this is the first time this ability has been used within the target's presence this is considered a Surprise Attack and you may apply your Sneak Attack.

system.description:
• You are adept at throwing yourself in the way of harm to shield others. When a creature within 5 feet of you is targeted by an attack, you can throw yourself in front of an attack.
  • If the creature is willing, you may push them completely out of harm's way, becoming the target of the attack instead.
  • If they’re unwilling, you both take partial damage.

715H7ZYjQASb6Mvo.name: Ethereal Strings
715H7ZYjQASb6Mvo.description:
• Only available with Medium Modular Armor Build.

    • Your medium armor develops an ethereal webbing that allows you to fasten yourself to an object or person, pinning you to them until you detach from it/them.

      • You weigh down whatever you are fastened to, making an object harder to move or a person to take half their movement.

      • The webbing remains on the object or person you were fastened to until it is washed away, but does not hinder it in any way after you are no longer fastened to it/them.

      • If someone knows about this webbing, they may use it in your stead if you are willing, broken, or powered down.

      • One time use per short or long rest

system.description:
• Only available with Medium Modular Armor Build.

  • Your medium armor develops an ethereal webbing that allows you to fasten yourself to an object or person, pinning you to them until you detach from it/them.

    • You weigh down whatever you are fastened to, making an object harder to move or a person to take half their movement.

    • The webbing remains on the object or person you were fastened to until it is washed away, but does not hinder it in any way after you are no longer fastened to it/them.

    • If someone knows about this webbing, they may use it in your stead if you are willing, broken, or powered down.

    • One time use per short or long rest

• Slim and Fast

    • Dexterity +1 (Applied by Equipping Armor)

    • Within reason, you may slip through gaps where others may not.

795wwi2cUiG96XzD.name: Lightning Rod Recharge Roll
795wwi2cUiG96XzD.description:
• Add roll to Charge Amount (Not to Exceed your Max)

    • If it overflows the DM may use the discharge as they see fit.

system.description:
• Being a Squirrel you know how to teleport around the battlefield.

    • While organics use biological energy, as a Manikin you have to use elemental energy to use your teleportation magic.

STmUp5mwOKplalzp.name: Stored for Winter
STmUp5mwOKplalzp.description: • Retroactively purchase or pack any object that you have had the chance to purchase or pack in the last 24 hours.

system.description:
• You have an uncanny knack for knowing what you will need before you need it, allowing you to retroactively purchase or pack any object that you have had the chance to purchase or pack in the last 24 hours.

    • You can't use this feature to make a purchase or acquisition that contradicts history as you know it.

      • For example, you can't use this feature to purchase an item that you could not afford at the time, to pack an object that you could not have carried, or to commit a theft that could have resulted in an encounter.

    • Can only use this once per mission.

You know thieves’ cant: a set of slang, hand signals, and code terms used by professional criminals. A creature that knows thieves’ cant can hide a short message within a seemingly innocent statement. A listener who knows thieves’ cant understands the message.

XJUdagk6NDxqfbmK.name: Sneak Attack
XJUdagk6NDxqfbmK.description:
• Deal an extra 2d6 damage to one creature you hit with an attack where you have advantage on the attack roll.

    • The amount of the extra damage increases as you gain levels in this class, as shown in the Sneak Attack column of the Rogue table.

    • The attack must use a finesse or a ranged weapon.

    • If anything causes you to have disadvantage on the attack roll, even if after you strike, you cannot apply your sneak attack.

qwjNYoRp8Nj2kd7y.name: Mage Breaker
qwjNYoRp8Nj2kd7y.description:
• You may apply Sneak Attack without having advantage if the following is true:

      • Deal an extra 2d6 damage to one creature casting a spell that requires concentration.

        • The amount of the extra damage increases as you gain levels in this class, as shown in the Sneak Attack column of the Rogue table.
        • This breaks their concentration if it hits.

5Ur4c28GaefolES8.name: Opportunist
5Ur4c28GaefolES8.description:
• You may apply Sneak Attack without having advantage if the following is true:

    • Deal an extra 2d6 damage to one creature focusing on another creature hostile to them other than you within 5-feet of them.

      • The amount of the extra damage increases as you gain levels in this class, as shown in the Sneak Attack column of the Rogue table.

system.description:
• Beginning at 1st level, you fight with precision, taking advantage of momentary lapses in an opponent’s concentration.
    • Once per turn, you can deal extra weapon damage when you hit a creature with a finesse weapon or ranged weapon attack.
      • The amount of extra damage is shown in the Sneak Attack column of the Rogue table.
      • In order to apply this damage, you must not have disadvantage on the attack and your target must be within 5 feet of another enemy of the target who is not incapacitated.
        • Alternatively, you can apply Sneak Attack damage if you have advantage on the attack.

    • Mage Breaker

      • A creature is casting a spell that requires concentration.

        • This breaks their concentration if it hits.

    • Opportunist

      • A creature is focusing on another creature hostile to them other than you within 5-feet of them.

• Upon reaching 2nd level, you gain access to a special set of techniques known as Cunning Actions.

    • Found Here: Nep Nik Cunning Actions and Specialty Features

    • You know a number of cunning actions equal to the amount shown in the Cunning Actions Known column in the Rogue Class Table.

    • Whenever you gain a level in this class, you may exchange one cunning action you know for another.

    • Some cunning actions require you to expend Sneak Attack die to use.

      • If you do so, the next time you successfully apply sneak attack, it is reduced by the amount of sneak attack die expended.

        • These reductions are cumulative (Meaning if you use a feature that costs 1 sneak attack die three times, your next sneak attack is reduced by 3d6)

      • You can not use a cunning action if it would reduce your next sneak attack to below 0 die rolled.

        • Otherwise there are no limits.

      • Upon completing a short or long rest, your sneak attack total is reset to its normal amount.
Dual-Wielding, Finesse, Thrown (30/80)
Dual-Wielding, Finesse, Simple

MmRheNvSGzEo2XPV.name: Uncanny Dodge - Expend Sneak Attack Die
MmRheNvSGzEo2XPV.description:
• Halve the attack's damage against you.

    • By expending 3 Sneak Attack Die, you may use this ability to keep your reaction available for another attack.

7NhNWfvSitkhxroD.name: Uncanny Dodge
7NhNWfvSitkhxroD.description: • Halve the attack's damage against you.

system.description:
• Action Type: Varies (Typically Reaction)

  • Die Cost: Varies (Typically 0)

  • When an attacker you can see hits you with an attack, you can use your reaction to halve the attack's damage against you.

    • By expending 3 Sneak Attack Die, you may use this ability to keep your reaction available for another attack. (Return after Short Rest)

• You know how to land a strike and then slip away without reprisal.

    • During your turn, if you make a melee attack against a creature, that creature can't make opportunity attacks against you for the rest of your turn.

• You may use Sleight of Hand with advantage to plant a trap, bomb, or potion on a creature.

  • Alternatively, you may also throw these items up to 30 feet from you at a creature.

1w5EwCPPXBQHlFli.name: Poison, Basic (Bomb)
1w5EwCPPXBQHlFli.description:
• You may throw this and cause it to blow up in a 15 foot radius.
    • Basic: When a creature takes damage from the explosion, it makes a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or takes 2d4 poison damage and is poisoned until the end of your next turn.

system.description:
• You may throw this and cause it to blow up in a 15 foot radius.
    • Basic: When a creature takes damage from the explosion, it makes a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or takes 2d4 poison damage and is poisoned until the end of your next turn.

• Your confidence propels you into battle.

    • You can give yourself a bonus to your initiative rolls equal to your Charisma modifier.

effects.name: Skillful Recklessness Modifier
effects.description: • Gives a bonus to your initiative rolls equal to your Charisma modifier.

system.description:
• You gain the ability to decipher an opponent's tactics and develop a counter to them.

    • As a bonus action, you can make an Intelligence (Insight) check against a creature you can see that isn't incapacitated, contested by the target's Charisma (Deception) check.

      • If you succeed, you can use your Sneak Attack against that target even if you don't have advantage on the attack roll, but not if you have disadvantage on it.

        • This benefit lasts for 1 minute or until you successfully use this feature against a different target.

• Claudia can pass beyond the construct for a short time just as she could with the tower, but within a minute of leaving the construct the binding stone cementing her to this plane of existence summons her back.

    • If the stone is destroyed she will be instantly thrown into the astral plane from whence she came and Nepnik will walk the world without her influence.

    • At any moment NepnIk could destroy the binding stone that binds Claudia to this plane of existence.

      • She is well aware of this, and leaves her fate in his hands to prove her faith and trust in him.

• These potions have auras of evocation magic invisible to mundane eyes.
    • When the bright red fluid contained within is spilt upon a creature, they regain 2d4 + 2 hit points.

thV7BVP6jCDiymEd.name: Defender

activation.reactionTrigger: When a creature within 5 feet of you is targeted by an attack.

thV7BVP6jCDiymEd.description:
• You are adept at throwing yourself in the way of harm to shield others. When a creature within 5 feet of you is targeted by an attack, you can throw yourself in front of an attack.

    • If the creature is willing, you may push them completely out of harm's way, becoming the target of the attack instead.

      • If they’re unwilling, you both take partial damage.

system.description:
• Heavy Armor - ⅔ to full health

    • AC: 18

      • Note: Disadvantage on Stealth checks.

  • Heavy Modular Armor Speed

    • Walking: 20 feet walking

    • Climbing: 20 feet

    • Swimming: 5 feet

  • Defender

    • Only available with Heavy Modular Armor Build.

    • Strength + 1.

    • You are adept at throwing yourself in the way of harm to shield others. When a creature within 5 feet of you is targeted by an attack, you can throw yourself in front of an attack.

      • If the creature is willing, you may push them completely out of harm's way, becoming the target of the attack instead.

        • If they’re unwilling, you both take partial damage.

  • Powerful Build

    • Only available with Heavy Modular Armor Build.

    • You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

  • Living Decoy

    • Only available with Heavy Modular Armor Build.

    • Your armor is so thick it shines and reflects light, causing most to have a hard time focusing on anything other than you.

effects.name: Heavy AC Replacement
effects.description:
• Heavy Armor - ⅔ to full health

    • AC: 18

      • Note: Disadvantage on Stealth checks.

effects.name: Heavy Disadvantaged Stealth Checks
effects.description: • Disadvantage on Stealth checks.

effects.name: Heavy Speed Adjustment
effects.description:
• Heavy Modular Armor Speed

    • Walking: 20 feet walking

    • Climbing: 20 feet

    • Swimming: 5 feet

effects.name: Heavy Living Decoy
effects.description: • Your armor is so thick it shines and reflects light, causing most to have a hard time focusing on anything other than you.

system.description: • At 2nd level, when Myra hits you with a Summoned Energizing Arrow, it grants Nep Nik 2 Charge.

(Cleric)

You impart fell energies that suck away the target's life force, making a melee spell attack that deals 3d10 necrotic damage.

Cast at Higher Levels. The damage increases by 1d10 for each slot level above 1st.

(Bard, Cleric, Druid, Paladin, Ranger, Sorcerer, Wizard)

Until the spell ends, you automatically sense the presence of magic within range, and you can use an action to study the aura of a magic effect to learn its schools of magic (if any).

The spell penetrates most barriers but is blocked by 3 feet of wood or dirt, 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, or a thin sheet of lead.

Cast at Higher Levels:

  • When using a 2nd-level spell slot or higher, the spell no longer requires your concentration.
  • When using a 3rd-level spell slot, the duration increases to 1 hour.
  • When using a 4th-level spell slot or higher, the duration increases to 8 hours.

fLAwCIOUGkt6r38b.onSave: They take half damage and are only pulled 10 feet

system.description:
(cleric, druid, ranger, sorcerer, warlock, wizard)

  • You fire a projectile of condensed gravitational force toward a creature you can see within range.
    • Make a ranged spell attack against the target.
    • On a hit, the target takes 2d8 force damage and is pulled 20 feet in a
      straight line toward you.
      • If they're successful with their dexterity save they take half the damage and are only pulled 10 feet

Cast at Higher Levels:

  • When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 1st.

 

Source: Steinhardt's Guild Spells

You draw upon divine power, imbuing the targets with fortitude. Until the spell ends, each target increases its hit point maximum and current hit points by 5.

Cast at Higher Levels. The granted hit points increase by an additional 5 for each slot level above 2nd.
• These Nanite Gold Earrings are special to Nep Nik and can be used by him in various ways.

DhpIjXIsV27s4cHa.name: Patchwork
DhpIjXIsV27s4cHa.description:
• As a free action, at any time, you may use your Nanite Gold Earrings to heal you for 1d6 for each spent.

    • You roll 1d6 for each individually.

    • A Nanite Gold Earring is used up in the process.

    • To use this, you must be conscious.

system.description:
• As a free action, at any time, you may use your Earrings to heal you for 1d6 for each spent.

    • You roll 1d6 for each individually.

    • An Earring is used up in the process.

    • To use this, you must be conscious.

DhpIjXIsV27s4cHa.name: Oil Can
DhpIjXIsV27s4cHa.description:
• You may use 2 Nanite Gold Earrings as your Reaction to remove gold from a burnt area to free up movement.

    • They return to your ear after.

system.description:
• You may use 2 Nanite Gold Earrings as your Reaction to remove gold from a Welded area to free up movement.

    • They return to your ear after the damage is repaired.

    • Roll 1d6 for each Welded location
      • 1-2: Remains Welded Shut
      • 2-6: Damage Repaired
      • If there is only one Welded area, you may roll twice on it.
      • If there is more than one Welded area, then you must roll for each until the damage is repaired.
        • You may only roll twice for this ability per round.

• At 3rd level, you have specialized in potions in a way that allows you to pitch vials at a distance with proficiency as a bonus action.

    • You gain proficiency with Alchemist's Supplies.

    • Your potions are now considered Splash Potions.

      • Splash Potions may be thrown at a target creature within 40 ft. of you using a bonus action.

        • If the target is unwilling to receive the effects of the Splash Potion, you must make an attack roll to hit them with the Splash Potion.

          • The attack roll uses your Dexterity modifier.

            • You are proficient with the attack.

These tools allow you to turn a specific type of raw material into generic trade goods using your time, effort, and skill. The type of tool determines the materials and amount of time needed. After spending the needed time and materials, you make a profession check with those tools which determines the value of the resulting generic trade goods (on a result of 15 or lower the materials used are wasted).

Material: 10 gp of alchemical ingredients

Time: 8 hours

DC Value
15 15 gp
20 20 gp
25+ 30 gp

activation.reactionTrigger: When Nepnik (or a companion) grapples a creature within 5 feet.

system.description:
• When Nepnik (or a companion) grapples a creature within 5 feet, Claudia may envelop them for a moment, surrounding them in nightmares, Blinding, Deafening, or Restraining them for a turn (your choice).

    • She may remain behind and stay attached to the creature as long as she isn’t shaken loose.

      • The creature must roll an intelligence contest save to free themselves.

      • Claudia cannot use any of her abilities until she lets go or is shaken free.

    • The terror cripples them, making them unable to make a noise until the Grappled Terror ends.

      • They take 1d4 psychic damage per turn

• Claudia can use gold from Nepnik’s reserves/from the battlefield to mend him as a bonus action.

    • Note: If he wants to remain as unarmored, she can use the gold to heal him and keep him there as long as a bonus action is available.

      • However, if he is reduced to 0HP, he will fall into disrepair and the Binding Stone pulls Claudia inside to protect her.

        • Someone else will have to use gold and fire to repair him.

    • Alternatively, she can use this to pull gold from him to change up his build, lowering his HP to drop him from Heavy to Medium or Medium to Unarmored.

• Walls do not obstruct her ability to feel what is beyond them and, if she wishes, Claudia can step out of the construct and through a wall to get a better look at what she believes may be on the other side.

    • She may choose to remain invisible to the naked eye or show herself in her Banshee form.

      • During this she cannot use other abilities or aid Nepnik.

    • This can only happen once per long rest.

• Starting at 2nd Level, Claudia may use a bonus action to reach out a spiritual tendril and touch a creature adjacent to the construct, casting Living Nightmares on that creature.

      • They see the thing they are most terrified of appearing before them and must react unless they roll an Intelligence Contest to save.

        • The DM chooses how they react.

        • If successful, she cannot use this ability again on the same creature.

      • You can only use this ability an equal amount to your Intelligence proficiency bonus between each short or long rest.

• Claudia can use Nepnik’s bonus action to open spiritual eyes that glow and hover in the air around the Construct.

    • The eyes have an ethereal quality and can be sustained without concentration for 1 minute.

      • For the duration, creatures within 30 feet of you can’t gain advantage on attack rolls against you as a result of being invisible or unseen.

      • Creatures that are invisible or unseen are revealed to Nep Nik

    • You can only use this ability an equal amount to your Intelligence proficiency bonus between each short or long rest.

• Medium Armor - ⅓ to just under ⅔ health

    • AC: 15

  • Medium Modular Armor Speed

    • Walking: 30 feet walking

    • Climbing: 30 feet

    • Swimming: 10 feet

  • Thespian

    • Only available with Medium Modular Armor Build.

    • Charisma +1

    • Additional Proficiency:

      • Performance Skill

      • You were quite the musician when organic and are proficient with most Instruments.

    • This is the form you use when wanting to appear more like a regular Squirrel, as your size fits the organic versions of your race.

  • Ethereal Strings

    • Only available with Medium Modular Armor Build.

    • Your medium armor develops an ethereal webbing that allows you to fasten yourself to an object or person, pinning you to them until you detach from it/them.

    • You weigh down whatever you are fastened to, making an object harder to move or a person to take half their movement.

    • The webbing remains on the object or person you were fastened to until it is washed away, but does not hinder it in any way after you are no longer fastened to it/them.

    • If someone knows about this webbing, they may use it in your stead if you are willing, broken, or powered down.

    • One time use per short or long rest

  • Rebound

    • Only available with Medium Modular Armor Build.

    • Bouncers are built into parts of your armor that, when activated, launch you off of something else.

      • If knocked down, you may use them to launch yourself back up.

      • If thrown into a wall, you may use them to launch yourself away from the wall.

      • If thrown into an object you may use them to launch you and the object away from one another.

        • As a bonus action, you may use this propelled momentum to strike out for an additional 1d6.

          • If this is the first time this ability has been used within the target's presence this is considered a surprise attack.

system.description:
• Unarmored - Under ⅓ health

    • AC: 11 + your Dexterity modifier

      • Note: Advantage on Stealth Checks

  • Unarmored Modular Armor Speed

    • Walking: 40 feet walking

    • Climbing: 40 feet

    • Swimming: 20 feet

  • Lethal Shadow

    • Only available with Unarmored Modular Armor Build.

    • Dexterity +1

    • Activates the Following Ability:

      • Chameleon

        • Without armor to obstruct the illusionary magic of your runes, you may shift the illusions to perfectly blend into your surroundings as long as an enemy isn’t aware of your location.

        • You gain expertise in the Stealth skill.

  • Slim and Fast

    • Only available with Unarmored Modular Armor Build.

    • Within reason, you may slip through gaps where others may not.

effects.description: AC: 11 + Dex Mod - Replaces AC

effects.description: Stealth Advantage

    • Climbing: 40 feet

    • Swimming: 20 feet

effects.name: Unarmored Dexterity +1
effects.description: • Dexterity +1

effects.name: Unarmored Invisibility
effects.description: You are invisibile by all means besides magical detection.

1w5EwCPPXBQHlFli.name: TNT GO BOOM
1w5EwCPPXBQHlFli.description:
• You may throw this and cause it to blow up in a 15 foot radius.
    • Basic: When a creature takes damage from the explosion, it makes a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or takes 2d4 poison damage and is poisoned until the end of your next turn.

system.description:
• You may set this down, light the fuse from up to 30 feet away to cause a 30 foot explosion.
  • Alternatively you can set it down and have someone ignite it from a distance with fire.
  • Alternatively it can be thrown 30-80 feet.
Lockpick Tool

• Taking the Dash action gives you additional movement, equal to your speed, for the current turn.
    • For a creature with a walking speed of 30ft, this means their movement for that turn would increase to 60ft.
      • This bonus includes any modifiers to your speed
      • This also applies to negative modifiers
      • Note: A situation that often causes confusion is when you Dash after standing up from being prone, which costs half of your movement.
        • Creatures with 30ft speed who are standing up from being knocked prone only has 15ft of movement remaining, but Dash doubles the original 30ft, and therefore they can move 45ft after getting up from being knocked prone.

effects.name: DASH
effects.description: No description available.

system.description:
• If you are able to make multiple attacks with the Attack action, this maneuver replaces one of them.
  • You may use your Disarm maneuver to attempt to knock an item or weapon from a creature's hand.
    • The target must be within your reach and be holding an item (either carried or wielded).
      • The target makes a Strength or Dexterity saving throw against your maneuver DC.
        • The target has advantage if it is larger than you or holding the item with two or more hands
        • Alternatively, a target smaller than you has disadvantage.
          • On a failure, you deal basic melee damage and the target drops the item in its space.

• Allows a character to evade opportunity attacks for the rest of their turn.
    • It’s a defensive tactic used when you want to safely move away from an enemy without risking a free swing.

• When you take the Dodge action, you focus entirely on avoiding attacks.
    • Until the start of your next turn, any attack roll made against you has disadvantage if you can see the attacker.
    • Addtionally, you make Dexterity saving throws with advantage.
    • Note: You lose these benefits if you are incapacitated or if your speed drops to 0.

• While you cannot grapple a creature two or more size categories larger than you, you can grab onto it.
    • By jumping onto its back or climbing up a limb, you can make a Strength or Dexterity saving throw against the creature's maneuver DC to cling to or balance upon its body.
      • On a success, you move into the creature's space and can move upon its body as if it is difficult terrain.
  • While grabbing onto a larger creature, you gain advantage on attack rolls against it.
    • The larger creature may be able to attack you as normal, depending on its limbs or attacks.
      • It can also use an action or replace one of its attacks on its turn to try to dislodge you, such as shaking you loose or bashing you against a wall, forcing you to make a Strength or Dexterity saving throw against its maneuver DC or fall prone into the nearest space adjacent to the creature, taking its basic melee damage in the process.
  • If the creature chooses to roll over in order to dislodge you, it becomes prone, but you have disadvantage on the saving throw to hang on.

• If you are able to make multiple attacks with the Attack action, this maneuver replaces one of them.
  • You can use the Grapple maneuver to grab or wrestle a creature
    • You must have at least one free hand to attempt a grapple, your target must be within your reach, and the target must be no more than one size category larger than you.
      • The target makes a Strength or Dexterity saving throw against your maneuver DC.
        • On a failure, you deal basic melee damage and the target becomes grappled.
          • In addition to things that end the condition, you can release the target at any time (no action required).
  • Escaping a Grapple
    • While grappled, a creature can use its action to attempt to escape. It must succeed on a Strength or Dexterity saving throw against your maneuver DC.
  • Moving a Grappled Creature
    • When you move, you can drag or carry the grappled creature with you.
      • When you do so, your Speed is halved, unless the creature's weight is within your carrying capacity and you are not encumbered by bulky items.
  • Freeing a Grappled Creature
    • You can use the Grapple maneuver to try to free another grappled or restrained creature.
      • The creature grappling or restraining the target makes a Strength saving throw against your maneuver DC.
        • If it fails the saving throw, the grappled or restrained creature is freed.
        • Additionally, you may move the freed creature 5 feet in any direction.

• If you are able to make multiple attacks with the Attack action, this maneuver replaces one of them.
  • You can use the Knockdown maneuver to trip or push a creature down.
    • The target must be within your reach and be no more than one size category larger than you.
    • The target makes a Strength saving throw against your maneuver DC.
      • On a failure, you deal basic melee damage and knock the target prone.

• You can use an action or bonus action to make an Overrun maneuver to move through a hostile creature's space by forcing your way past.
    • Make a Strength saving throw against the target's maneuver DC.
      • On a success, you deal basic melee damage and can move through the hostile creature's space once this turn.
      • The creature can choose to let you pass instead of rolling.
      • You have advantage if you are larger than the target, or disadvantage if you are smaller.
      • If you are two or more sizes smaller than the target, you can move through the hostile creature's space without making a save.
      • You still provoke opportunity attacks if you move beyond a creature's reach.

• If you are able to make multiple attacks with the Attack action, this maneuver replaces one of them.
  • You can use the Shove maneuver to push a creature away.
    • The target must be within your reach and be no more than one size category larger than you.
      • The target makes a Strength saving throw against your maneuver DC.
        • On a failure, you deal basic melee damage and push the target a number of feet away from you equal to 5 + 5 for every 5 points it failed its saving throw by.
          • You can move the creature in any direction away from you (to the side, forward, or diagonally away).
    • A creature that is shoved off of a precipice is propelled off of whatever it is standing on -- it does not receive any saving throw or ability check to grab onto something to avoid falling down below.

• Instead of using a weapon to make a melee weapon attack, you can use an unarmed strike: a punch, kick, head-butt, or similar forceful blow (none of which count as weapons).
    • On a hit, an Unarmed Strike deals bludgeoning damage equal to 1 + your Strength modifier.
      • You are proficient with your unarmed strikes.
      • This damage cannot be halved by a saving throw.

• Claudia can pass beyond the construct for a short time just as she could with the tower, but within a minute of leaving the construct the binding stone cementing her to this plane of existence summons her back.

    • If the stone is destroyed she will be instantly thrown into the astral plane from whence she came and Nep Nik will walk the world without her influence.

    • At any moment Nep NIk could destroy the binding stone that binds Claudia to this plane of existence.

      • She is well aware of this, and leaves her fate in his hands to prove her faith and trust in him.

One of the many secrets unveiled about Sevani Dreigh Ude by Mogli is the discovery of how to create Portal Coins for his Elite Warriors. By sacrificing his own life force, one full year to be exact, he can fuse a coin to the blood of one of his Elite. Only the person fused to the coin can use the Portal Coin to return to Sevani Dreigh Ude. These coins can also be used by his Elite to return to Mogli's side, but this can only occur once per day as he does not carry the same amount of power to move creatures across the cosmos as Sevani Dreigh Ude encompasses.

• When lit, this incense fills the area with a calming and purifying scent.
    • It can create a 30-foot radius of sacred space, protecting it from undead intrusions for 3 rounds.
    • Undead within the smoke must get clear of it by the end of their next turn or fall prone until the smoke ends.

effects.name: Undead Prone Effect
effects.description: If an undead creature doesn't clear the smoke by the end of their turn they will fall prone.

system.description:
• This dagger’s blade is engraved with symbols of compassion.
    • When used to deliver a killing blow to a creature, it ensures that the creature finds peace in death and does not reanimate.
      • You may stab a vanquished creature with this blade as a bonus action to make sure they remain dead.

• At Level 2, Nepnik has proven to be one who can build something out of damn near anything:

    • This feature can be used once every hour (More or Less depending on the DM’s discretion thematically)

    • As long as it makes sense thematically, as a reaction he may say something along the lines of, “I made a thing” or “This might work” or “It’s Perfect” and produce something he has just Macgyvered on the fly from things lying around.

• Those who are near a Kazrem Azryel often describe the feeling of being seen entirely, inside and out.

    • Their natural perceptiveness gives them a keen advantage over their surroundings and a deeper insight into those they can see.

  • Although Claudia has given up much of her Kazrem Azryel power, she remains adept at picking out lies.

    • Whenever you make an Intelligence (Insight) check to determine whether a creature is lying or hiding something, treat a roll of 9 or lower on the d20 as an automatic roll of 10.

  • Claudia is proficient in the Perception and Insight skills, but uses Nepnik’s Intelligence modifier in place of Wisdom.

• Claudia has the Aid Cantrip and can use it once per short/long rest.

      • Casting Time: Free action

      • A tendril of her energy snaps out from Nepnik at an hour of need and aids a teammate within 30 feet by adding 1d4 to their saving throw.

    • She may choose a Cantrip at this time from the Cleric Spell List.

    • The Banshee table shows how many spells and spell slots she has from the Cleric Spell list.

      • Spells and Cantrips are found Here: Cleric Spell List - DND 5th Edition

      • Claudia immediately knows three 1st-level cleric spells of your choice, two of which must be chosen from the divination and necromancy spells on the cleric spell list.

        • Each spell learned from here on through 7th-level must come from the Divination and Necromancy spells

          • You can replace these spells whenever you gain a level, but the assortment of spells must stay the same.

          • The spells you learn at 8th, 14th, and 20th levels can come from any Cleric’s school of magic.

        • To cast one of these spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher.

        • You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.

      • SPELLCASTING ABILITY

        • Nepnik’s Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for your cleric spells.

        • You use Nepnik’s Intelligence whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability.

          • In addition, you use Nepnik’s Intelligence modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a cleric spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

        • Spell save DC = 8+ your proficiency bonus + Nepnik’s Intelligence modifier

        • Spell attack modifier your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier

This item encompasses a wide range of playing card types, both unmarked and marked.

If you are proficient with a gaming set, you can add your proficiency bonus to ability checks you make to play a game with that set. Each type of gaming set requires a separate proficiency.

• At Level 3, Nepnik may use his Scrounge Tinkerer feature to immediately pick something up and use it as a weapon:

    • You may use any tiny object as a thrown weapon.

      • You’re proficient in the use of improvised thrown weapons which now count as a ranged weapon for you if what is used is a tiny object.

        • The object; when used this way, has a range of 30/60 feet and deals 1d4 plus your dexterity modifier piercing damage on a hit.

      • You have proficiency in Playing Card Set

        • These, too, can be considered flingable items.

    • AC: 18

      • Note: Disadvantage on Stealth checks.

effects.name: Heavy Living Decoy
effects.description: • Your armor is so thick it shines and reflects light, causing most to have a hard time focusing on anything other than you.

• An invisible creature is impossible to see without the aid of magic or a special sense (it gains no benefits from this condition against creatures still able to see it).
  • An invisible creature is heavily obscured for the purpose of hiding.
  • An invisible creature's location can be detected by noises it makes or tracks it leaves.
  • Attack rolls against an invisible creature are made with disadvantage.
  • An invisible creature makes attack rolls with advantage.
effects.name: Invisible
